name: The Green Fellows Program
description: The Green Fellows Program is designed to recognize and support individuals committed to addressing global sustainability challenges. By participating in our conference series and engaging with experts, fellows gain valuable knowledge, expand their networks, and enhance their research skills.

name: FAO Nepal Internship Programme
description: The FAO Internship Programme for Asia and the Pacific (RAP) provides students and recent graduates (21-30 years) with hands-on experience in sustainable agri-food systems, contributing to global food security and the UN Sustainable Development Goals. Interns engage in projects aligned with FAO’s mission, gaining exposure to international development work in diverse, multicultural settings. The program prioritizes inclusivity, encouraging applications from women, underrepresented nations, and persons with disabilities. Successful candidates receive a stipend and opportunities to enhance skills while supporting FAO’s vision of resilient, equitable food systems worldwide.

name: Eco Club Awards 2025
description: WWF Nepal announces a call for video applications for the Best Eco Club Award 2025. This year our theme is 'Contribution of Eco Clubs to Local Environmental Conservation'. Submit your videos and win exciting prizes.

name: The Rockefeller Foundation Big Bets Fellowship
description: The Big Bets Fellowship: Climate | Asia-Pacific is an annual initiative supporting emerging leaders committed to reversing the climate crisis and advancing opportunities for vulnerable communities.

name: Start Strong in 2025: The Wilderness Impact Challenge
description: The Wilderness Trust Impact Challenge 2025 – Protect Edition is a global call to action for innovators, researchers, and community leaders to develop bold solutions for advancing conservation across Africa.
address: Namibia, Botswana, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Tanzania, Kenya, and Rwanda

name: Australia Awards Nepal Regional Short Course on Accessing Climate Finance.
description: The Australia Awards Short Course on accessing climate finance offers funded, short-term training to enhance participants' knowledge, skills, and networks for driving climate action. It focuses on climate finance mechanisms, sustainable investments, policy frameworks, and innovative financial solutions to support climate resilience and low-carbon development.

name: International School on Climate Mobilities (ISCM) 2025
description: The International School on Climate Mobilities (ISCM), hosted by the Beyond Climate Collaborative, offers an enriching interdisciplinary  educational program designed to connect and engage emerging scholars, practitioners, and change-makers in critical knowledge exchange. This program equips participants with the tools necessary to address the complexities of climate change, environmental impacts, and climate-induced mobility

name: European Climate Pact Flagship Event 2025
description: The European Climate Pact invites changemakers, policymakers, and citizens to join its flagship event on March 19, 2025, in Brussels, Belgium. This annual gathering is a celebration of climate action, progress, and collaboration. The event will provide a platform for discussions, workshops, and networking opportunities to advance climate resilience and sustainability across Europe

name: Australia Awards Scholarships
description: Australia Awards are prestigious international Scholarships and Short Courses funded by the Australian Government. An Australia Awards Scholarship provides the opportunity to gain an internationally recognised master’s degree from a globally-recognised Australian institution. It includes all the necessary support and funding to complete your study.
